Title:
A new Neopaxillus species (Basidiomycota, Agaricomycetes)
from the Dominican Republic, and the status of Neopaxillus within
Agaricales
Abstract:
A new Neopaxillus, viz.Â N. dominicanus, is reported from
the Dominican Republic. It is well circumscribed by having a basidiome
with decurrent and distant white gills with evident pink-lilac tinges at
maturity, well developed cheilocystidia, and echinulate globose spores.
The study includes a description, color photographs of fresh basidiomes
and line drawings of relevant microscopic traits. N. dominicanus is very
close to Neopaxillus echinospermus, the type species of the genus
Neopaxillus. Based on comparative ITS-LSU rDNA gene sequence analyses,
Neopaxillus, a genus formerly placed in Boletales, is considered within
Agaricales and it is basal or sister to Crepidotus (Crepidotaceae).
